job.title: Data Scientist
job.description:
The things that you will tackle:


  • Ability to understand the business context and identify use-cases where data science and technology can drive the business solution
  • Design, create, test and implement complex models and algorithms that drive analytical solutions throughout the organization
  • Conduct advanced statistical and other analyses to provide actionable insights, identify trends, and measure performance.
  • Collaborate with the Product, Engineer, and Business teams and understands business problems to implement scalable and sustainable solutions
  • Coordinate with MIS, Digital Specialists, and Data Engineers to deliver holistic analytical solutions
  • Support translators in communicating the design, functioning, and output of the analytical models/solutions developed
  • Ensure timely analysis and testing for regular maintenance of solutions over time

What you will need to be successful:

  • Advanced Degree in Computer Science, Computer Applications, Statistics, Mathematics or other relevant field is strongly preferred
  • Strong experience in a statistical and/or data science/business intelligence role
  • Prior experience in machine learning, statistics, optimization, or related fields; deeper experience in working with large data sets, simulation/ optimization, or distributed computing tools is a plus
  • Leverage solid principles and a clear framework when approaching data science and data engineer tasks; demonstrates second-order thinking
  • Deep understanding of data science techniques and their mathematical underpinnings
  • Experience with programming is required; specific experience in R or Python is a plus
  • Experience of working with large data sets, simulation/ optimization, and distributed computing tools (Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, etc.) is a plus
  • Previous experience with healthcare or social network use cases are a plus
  • User research and user testing. Experience with quantitative methods and analytics is a plus.
